Organizzazione o partecipazione come rel.content: "Economics and Free Market: The Austrian Perspective". Dewan Seminar A, Pusat Konvensyen, Universiti Utara Malaysia (UUM), Kedah Darul Aman, Malaysia. Conference promoted by IDEAS, Institute for Democracy and Economic Affairs, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia.
"A Crisis from the West, an Opportunity for the East. Business Cycles, Free Market and Sovereign Debts". University of Management and Technology (UmTech), Petaling Jaya, Malaysia.

"A Crisis from the West, an Opportunity for the East. Business Cycles, Free Market and Sovereign Debts". Post Graduate Room, University Malaya, Faculty of Economics and Administration, Department of Economics, FEAUM, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia.

"A Crisis from the West, an Opportunity for the East. Business Cycles, Free Market and Sovereign Debts". INTI University & Colleges, Subang Jaya, Malaysia. Conference promoted by IDEAS, Institute for Democracy and Economic Affairs, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia.

"A Crisis from the West, an Opportunity for the East. Business Cycles, Free Market and Sovereign Debts". University of Nottingham – Malaysia Campus, Semenyih, Malaysia. Conference promoted by IDEAS, Institute for Democracy and Economic Affairs, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia.
"The Causes of European Debt Crisis". INTI University & Colleges, Subang Jaya, Malaysia.
"European Debt Crisis – Contained or Contagious?". With M.-A. Tourres and E. Koerner, University of Wollongong, Malaysia Campus, INTI University & Colleges, Subang Jaya, Malaysia.

"Public Deficit or Balanced Budgets? Lessons from the USA and EU cases". Lecture presented at the Auditorium of Inti International College Subang, Subang Jaya, Malaysia. Lecture linked with the launch of the book "Phoenix Economics. From Crisis to Renascence" (New York, Nova Publishers, 2013) by Carmelo Ferlito. Carmelo Ferlito discusses the content of the books with Emeritus Professor Barry Harper, Pro Vice-Chancellor Sourth East Asia, University of Wollongong Programs, Inti Collges, and Dr. Marie-Aimee Touress, Associate Director, Asia Global Risk. Event organized by INTI International College Subang, University of Wollongong and Friedrich A. von Hayek Institute Malaysia.
"Globalization – Trends & Issues". With M.-A. Tourres and Nicholas A. Crist, University of Wollongong, Malaysia Campus, INTI University & Colleges, Subang Jaya, Malaysia.

"Entrepreneurship and Entrepreneurs. State of Grace of Basic Feature of Human Action?". Lecture presented at the Sydney Business School MBA Program, Malaysia Campus, INTI International University and Colleges, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia.

"Ludwig M. Lachmann against the Cambridge School. Macroeconomics, Microfoundations, Expectations, Rate of Profit, Equilibrium and Innovations", paper presented at the conference “Hayek, Keynes and the crisis. Analyses and Remedies – Hayek et Keynes face à la crise: analyses et remèdes”, Faculté Jean Monnet, Salle Georges Vedel, 54 boulevard Desgranges, 92330 Sceaux. Event organized by Université Paris Sud, International Journal of Political Economy, Review of Keynesian Economics, Association Fracaise d’Economie Politique.

"At the Root of Economic Fluctuations: Expectations, Preferences and Innovation. Theoretical Framework and Empirical Evidences", paper presented at the on-line conference “The European Crisis”, World Economics Association Conference n. 2-2015, 1st October to 1st December, 2015.

"The Classical Roots of the Austrian Capital Theory" (with F. Meacci), paper presented at the SIBR-UniKL Conference on Interdisciplinary Business & Economics Research, February 12-13, 2016, Kuala Lumpur.

"The Chinese financial crisis and its impact on Asia"; a breakout session with Dr Carmelo Ferlito (IDEAS Senior Fellow), Andrew Shuen (Lion Rock Institute), Li Weisen (Fudan University) and Ma Shoulong (Renmin University). Breakout session part of the Asia Liberty Forum 2016, February 18-20, 2016, Renaissance Hotel, Kuala Lumpur. Event organized by The Atlas Network in collaboration with the Institute for Democracy and Economic Affairs (IDEAS) and the Centre for Civil Society.
